noun.description: Zoology. The middle lobe of the foot of a mollusc.
Botany. Originally; the region of a leaf primordium corresponding to the petiole; the petiole itself. Later also: an internode between prophylls in certain compound inflorescences.
Zoology. The section of a tetrapod limb (especially of an amphibian or reptile) constituted by the carpus (in the forelimb) or the tarsus (in the hind limb); the mesopodial bones collectively.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Huxley (1825–1895), biologist and science educationist. From meso- + -podium.
